com.activelook.activelooksdk

Interface GlassesCommands

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Glasses
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GlassesCommandsAdapter

    public interface GlassesCommands

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void als(boolean enable)
      Turn on/off only the auto brightness adjustment.
      void battery(androidx.core.util.Consumer<Integer> onResult)
      Ask glasses battery level and run the callback with results.

      Draw an empty circle at the corresponding coordinates.

      Draw a full circle at the corresponding coordinates.

      Draw a full circle at the corresponding coordinates.

      Clear glasses screen

      Sets the grey level (0 to 15) used to draw the next graphical element.

      Turn glasses debug mode on of off.

      Send demo command.

      Set luminance to a given percentage.
      void fontDelete(byte id)
      Erase font from flash if present.

      Give the list of font saved into the device with their size.

      Save font nb of size Bytes.
      void fontSelect(byte id)
      Selects font which will be used for followings txt commands.

      Display value (in percentage) of the gauge ([1…4]).

      Stream 1bpp bitmap image on display without saving it in memory.

      Clears screen of the corresponding layout area.

    • Method Detail

      • power

        void power(boolean on)
        Turn glasses power on of off.
        Parameters:
        on - Turn on or off

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear glasses screen

      • grey

        void grey(byte level)
        Set glasses screen to a grey level.
        Parameters:
        level - The grey level to set. It must be between 0x00 and 0x0F.
        See Also:
        Utils.greyLevel(int)

      • demo

        void demo()
        Send demo command.

      • test

        void test(DemoPattern pattern)
        Send the test command to the glasses.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to display in the glasses.

      • battery

        void battery(androidx.core.util.Consumer<Integer> onResult)
        Ask glasses battery level and run the callback with results.
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned value with an iteger between 0 and 100.

      • vers

        void vers(androidx.core.util.Consumer<GlassesVersion> onResult)
        Ask glasses for its version and run the callback with results.
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned value.

      • debug

        void debug(boolean on)
        Turn glasses debug mode on of off. When activated return BLE data received to USB.
        Parameters:
        on - Turn on or off

      • led

        void led(LedState state)
        Set glasses led mode
        Parameters:
        state - The mode to set

      • shift

        void shift(short x,
           short y)
        Shift next graphical commands with this offsets.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal offset
        y - The vertical offset

      • settings

        void settings(androidx.core.util.Consumer<GlassesSettings> onResult)
        Ask glasses for its settings and run the callback with results.
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned value.

      • setName

        void setName(String name)
        Customize BLE advertising name. The maximum name length is 15. Character encoding is 'ASCII'An empty name (n = 0). will reset it to the factory name An empty name will reset to factory name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to set

      • luma

        void luma(byte value)
        Set the display luminance to the corresponding level (0 to 15)
        Parameters:
        value - The luminance

      • dim

        void dim(byte value)
        Set luminance to a given percentage. It's not recommended to use this command when ALS is enabled since ALS will automatically overwrite dimming
        Parameters:
        value - The luminance percentage (OxOO to 0x64)

      • sensor

        void sensor(boolean enable)
        Turn on/off the auto-brightness adjustment and gesture detection.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set on or off.

      • gesture

        void gesture(boolean enable)
        Turn on/off only the gesture detection.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set on or off.

      • als

        void als(boolean enable)
        Turn on/off only the auto brightness adjustment.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set on or off.

      • setSensorParameters

        void setSensorParameters(SensorMode mode,
                         SensorParameters parameters)
        Set sensor parameters. Reboot of the device is necessary.
        Parameters:
        mode - ALS_ARRAY: it changes the ALS array to compare when luma is changed. Reboot the device is necessary. ALS_PERIOD: it changes ALS period. Reboot of the device is necessary. GESTURE_PERIOD: it changes gesture period. Reboot of the device is necessary.
        parameters - The sensor parameters to set.

      • getSensorParameters

        void getSensorParameters(androidx.core.util.Consumer<SensorParameters> onResult)
        Get sensor parameters (ALS Array, ALS Period and ranging Period).
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned value.

      • color

        void color(byte value)
        Sets the grey level (0 to 15) used to draw the next graphical element.
        Parameters:
        value - The selected color.

      • point

        void point(short x,
           short y)
        Set a pixel on at the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the point.
        y - The y coordinate of the point.

      • line

        void line(short x1,
          short y1,
          short x2,
          short y2)
        Draw a line at the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x coordinate of the starting point of the line.
        y1 - The y coordinate of the starting point of the line.
        x2 - The x coordinate of the ending point of the line.
        y2 - The y coordinate of the ending point of the line.

      • rect

        void rect(short x1,
          short y1,
          short x2,
          short y2)
        Draw an empty rectangle at the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
        y1 - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
        x2 - The x coordinate of the bottom right corner of the rectangle.
        y2 - The y coordinate of the bottom right corner of the rectangle.

      • rectf

        void rectf(short x1,
           short y1,
           short x2,
           short y2)
        Draw a full rectangle at the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
        y1 - The y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
        x2 - The x coordinate of the bottom right corner of the rectangle.
        y2 - The y coordinate of the bottom right corner of the rectangle.

      • circ

        void circ(short x,
          short y,
          byte r)
        Draw an empty circle at the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cirle center.
        y - The y coordinate of the cirle center.
        r - The radius of the circle.

      • circf

        void circf(short x,
           short y,
           byte r)
        Draw a full circle at the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cirle center.
        y - The y coordinate of the cirle center.
        r - The radius of the circle.

      • txt

        void txt(short x,
         short y,
         Rotation r,
         byte f,
         byte c,
         String s)
        Write text string at coordinates (x, y) with rotation, font size, and color.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for the text.
        y - The y coordinate for the text.
        r - The rotation of the text.
        f - The font size of the text.
        c - The color of the text.
        s - The text.

      • polyline

        void polyline(short[] xys)
        Draw multiple connected lines at the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        xys - Array of [x0, y1, x1, y1, ..., xn, yn]

      • imgList

        void imgList(androidx.core.util.Consumer<List<ImageInfo>> onResult)
        Give the list of bitmap saved into the device.
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned value.

      • imgSave

        void imgSave(ImageData data)
        Save 4bpp bitmap of size bytes and width pixels.
        Parameters:
        data - 4bpp Image data configuration object.

      • imgDisplay

        void imgDisplay(byte id,
                short x,
                short y)
        Display image id to the corresponding coordinates.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the image to display.
        x - The x coordinate for the image.
        y - The y coordinate for the image.

      • imgDelete

        void imgDelete(byte id)
        Erase all bitmaps with numbers >= id.
        Parameters:
        id - The id from which to delete images.

      • imgStream

        void imgStream(Image1bppData data,
               short x,
               short y)
        Stream 1bpp bitmap image on display without saving it in memory.
        Parameters:
        data - 1bpp Image data configuration object.
        x - The x coordinate for the image.
        y - The y coordinate for the image.

      • imgSave1bpp

        void imgSave1bpp(Image1bppData data)
        Save 1bpp bitmap of size bytes and width pixels.
        Parameters:
        data - 1bpp Image data configuration object.

        void fontList(androidx.core.util.Consumer<List<FontInfo>> onResult)
        Give the list of font saved into the device with their size.
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned value.

      • fontSave

        void fontSave(byte id,
              FontData data)
        Save font nb of size Bytes.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the font.
        data - The font configuration object.

      • fontSelect

        void fontSelect(byte id)
        Selects font which will be used for followings txt commands.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the font.

      • fontDelete

        void fontDelete(byte id)
        Erase font from flash if present.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the font.

      • layoutSave

        void layoutSave(LayoutParameters layout)
        Save a layout (Min 17 hexadecimal parameters).
        Parameters:
        layout - The layout configuration object.

      • layoutDelete

        void layoutDelete(byte id)
        Erase corresponding layout.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the layout.

      • layoutDisplay

        void layoutDisplay(byte id,
                   String text)
        Display text value with layout # Id parameters.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the layout.
        text - The text to display for this layout.

      • layoutClear

        void layoutClear(byte id)
        Clears screen of the corresponding layout area.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the layout.

      • layoutPosition

        void layoutPosition(byte id,
                    short x,
                    byte y)
        Redefine the position of a layout. Position is saved.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the layout.
        x - The x coordinate for the layout.
        y - The y coordinate for the layout.

      • layoutDisplayExtended

        void layoutDisplayExtended(byte id,
                           short x,
                           byte y,
                           String text)
        Display text value with layout at position x y. Position is not saved.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the layout.
        x - The x coordinate for the layout.
        y - The y coordinate for the layout.
        text - The text to display for this layout.

      • gaugeDisplay

        void gaugeDisplay(byte id,
                  byte value)
        Display value (in percentage) of the gauge ([1…4]).
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the gauge to display.
        value - Value in percentage for the gauge.

      • gaugeSave

        void gaugeSave(byte id,
               short x,
               short y,
               short r,
               short rin,
               byte start,
               byte end,
               boolean clockwise)
        Save the parameters for the gauge id.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the gauge.
        x - The x coordinate of the center of the gauge.
        y - The y coordinate of the center of the gauge.
        r - The radius of the outer circle of the gauge.
        rin - The radius of the inner circle of the gauge.
        start - The start angle of the gauge.
        end - The end angle of the gauge.
        clockwise - The orientation of the gauge.

      • pageSave

        void pageSave(byte id,
              Rotation r,
              byte[] layoutIds)
        Save parameters for a given page.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the page to save.
        r - The orientation of the page.
        layoutIds - The ids of the layouts included in the page.

      • pageGet

        void pageGet(androidx.core.util.Consumer<List<PageInfo>> onResult)
        Reads saved parameter of a page or all pages.
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned value.

      • pageDelete

        void pageDelete(byte id)
        Erase a page.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the page to delete.

      • pixelCount

        void pixelCount(androidx.core.util.Consumer<Integer> onResult)
        Get number of pixel activated on display.
        Parameters:
        onResult - Callback on to call on returned integer value.

      • setPixelValue

        void setPixelValue(int maxValue)
        Set Max Pixel Value.
        Parameters:
        maxValue - the pixel maximal value.

      • txt

        default void txt(android.graphics.Point p,
                 Rotation r,
                 byte f,
                 byte c,
                 String s)
        Write text string at coordinates(x0,y0) with rotation, font size, and color.
        Parameters:
        p - The coordinate for the text.
        r - The rotation of the text.
        f - The font size of the text.
        c - The color of the text.
